business.headline: Bihar Elections 2025: Here are the top 10 candidates with highest assetsBihar, often seen as a political pulse point for national trends, is set for a two-phase election that will decide the leadership of a state rich in history and political influence.

Pension rules clarified: How does your last working day impact benefits?Under the Central Civil Services (Pension) Rules, 2021, an employee's pension will now be calculated based on the rules that are active on their final day of service. This could be the day they retire, resign, are discharged from duty, or pass away — whichever happens first.

Zubeen, known for loud protests and quiet promotions, roped in veteran actor Victor Banerjee to play Victor, the teacher who transforms the world of the blind singer played by him. In real life, Banerjee runs a beautiful school for the blind, which is tucked in a corner of Assam. Was Zubeen, who is known for his charity, trying to send out a message?

AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal wooed voters with free bus rides and other freebies in 2019. Mamdani's socialist schemes, which hint at Indian-style populism, come in NYC, the heart of capitalist America.

Louvre museum system's password at time of $102 million jewel heist: LouvreThe extraordinary heist, which took place on October 19 in under seven minutes, forced the closure of the Louvre. Eight items of jewellery had been stolen from the Apollo Gallery, including the emerald-and-diamond necklace that Napoleon gave his wife Empress Marie Louise and the 19th-century crown of Empress Eugenie.

'My Son Is Like The Moon And Sun': Khesarilal Yadav's Father On His Son's SuperstardomThis special report features an exclusive interview with the parents of Bhojpuri superstar Khesarilal Yadav from their home in Chhapra, Bihar. His mother and father reflect on their son's incredible journey from a humble background to stardom. The father proudly states, 'My son is like the moon and sun in the sky to me today'. The interview, conducted by India Today's Mausmi Singh, delves into their past struggles, including moving to Delhi where the family sold litti chokha to make ends meet. Khesarilal's father, Mangaru Lal Yadav, discusses his own past as a performer and how his son inherited his talent, starting his journey by singing in a local bhajan group. The proud parents share their immense happiness and give blessings for his continued success, offering a heartfelt glimpse into the family life of one of Bhojpuri cinema's biggest names.

PM Modi's Pep Talk To India's World Cup-Winning Women Cricketers This special report focuses on Prime Minister Narendra Modi's recent interaction with the Indian women's cricket team following their historic World Cup victory. The news bulletin highlighted what was described as 'a very, very interesting and a fun conversation with our champions of the women Indian cricket team that has won the World Cup.' On November 5, 2025, the Prime Minister hosted the triumphant team at his residence, lauding their resilience and remarkable comeback during the tournament. Captain Harmanpreet Kaur and Vice-captain Smriti Mandhana shared how the PM's words have been a source of motivation. The interaction also touched upon the team's journey, with the Prime Minister urging the players to promote the Fit India movement. The report also references the first phase of polling for the Bihar Assembly elections, which commenced on November 6, 2025, for 121 seats.

Rishabh Pant Roars Back! Named Vice-Captain for South Africa Test Series.This special report covers the BCCI's announcement of the Indian Test squad for the upcoming series against South Africa, highlighting the return of star wicketkeeper-batsman Rishabh Pant as vice-captain. According to reports, 'when Rishabh Pant got injured during the England series, it was a big blow for Indian side because you know as far as Rishabh Pant's space in the team India is concerned, always you know everybody rates him very highly'. Pant, who suffered a foot fracture during the England tour in July, has proven his fitness by leading the India A side against South Africa A. The two-match Test series is scheduled to begin on November 14 in Kolkata, with Shubman Gill captaining the 15-member squad.
